By Andrew Trunsky
Daily Caller News Foundation
Several new polls show that former President Donald Trump's grip over the Republican Party may be slipping as the 2022 election cycle prepares to kick into gear.
Trump responded Sunday to allegations that his grip was loosening, saying that his endorsement is much stronger today than it was? even before the 2020 election.
I am almost unblemished in the victory count, and it is considered by the real pollsters to be the strongest endorsement in U.S. political history,? Trump said.
A YouGov poll from early February found that just 54% of Republicans had a very favorable? view of Trump, down nine points from October 2021.
While the February poll shows Trump's overall approval among Republicans stood at 76%, that figure was down 10 points over the same period.
There are plenty of existing politicians who wouldn't be in power now were it not for my Endorsement (like the Old Crow!
These statistics come ahead of dozens of high-stakes primary elections, some of which feature Trump-endorsed candidates.
